180 Cal. App. 3d 605 (1986)
225 Cal. Rptr. 624
HELEN RUTH STEVENS, Petitioner,
v.
THE SUPERIOR COURT OF LOS ANGELES COUNTY, Respondent; ST. FRANCIS MEDICAL CENTER, Real Party in Interest.
Docket No. B018532.
Court of Appeals of California, Second District, Division Four.
April 30, 1986.
*606 COUNSEL
Lawrence R. Booth and Daniel M. Graham for Petitioner.
No appearance for Respondent.
Rushfeldt, Shelley & McCurdy, Linda C. Miller, Randall L. Shelley, Greinis, Martin, Stein & Richland and Alan G. Martin for Real Party in Interest.
OPINION
WOODS, P.J.
(1a) This proceeding in mandate presents the question whether a cause of action for fraud and deceit against a hospital is pleaded *607 by factual allegations that the hospital intentionally concealed from the plaintiff and all other patients that foreign physicians, unlicensed to practice medicine in California, were authorized by the hospital to function as hospital staff physicians and surgeons on a daily basis without the supervision required by statute.
For the reasons discussed hereafter, we conclude that such alleged concealment of material fact and resulting injury may state a cause in actual fraud sufficient to overcome a general demurrer.
